Interface GameInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
ControllerGraphic, ControllerTerminal
public sealed interface GameInterface permits ControllerTerminal, ControllerGraphic
Interface representing the essential operations of a game controller, used for terminal and graphical implementations.
Author:
massinissa

  • Method Summary

    Method
    Description

  • Method Details

    • askForPosition

      Position askForPosition(Player player)
      Asks the player for a position on the board.
      Parameters:
      player - asked to choose.
      Returns:
      The selected position.

    • askForPair

      int askForPair(Shelf shelf)
      Asks the player to select a pair (tile and token) from the shelf.
      Parameters:
      shelf - The shelf containing tiles and tokens
      Returns:
      The ID of the selected pair.

    • displayMessage

      void displayMessage(String message, Color color, int x, int y, int size)
      Displays a message on the game view
      Parameters:
      message - The message to display
      color - The color of the message
      x - The x-coordinate position of the message.
      y - The y-coordinate position of the message.
      size - The font size of the message.

    • draw

      void draw(Shelf shelf, Player player)
      Draws the current state of the game, including the shelf and the player's board and informations
      Parameters:
      shelf - The shelf containing the tiles and tokens to display
      player - The player whose board and information are to be displayed

    • context

      default com.github.forax.zen.ApplicationContext context()
      Provides the application context for graphical implementations.
      Returns:
      The application context.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if the implementation does not support this operation.

    • askToUseNatureToken

      String askToUseNatureToken()
      Asks the player whether they want to use a Nature Token and specifies the available options.
      Returns:
      A string representing the player's choice: - "T" if the player chooses to select a unique tile and a unique token. - "J" if the player chooses to replace the tokens. - "" if the player choose not to use is.

    • askForTileId

      int askForTileId(Shelf shelf)
      makes the user to select a Tile ID from the shelf.
      Parameters:
      shelf - The shelf containing the available tokens.
      Returns:
      The ID of the selected token.

    • askForTokenId

      int askForTokenId(Shelf shelf)
      makes the user to select a token ID from the shelf.
      Parameters:
      shelf - The shelf containing the available tokens.
      Returns:
      The ID of the selected token.

    • displayEndScreen

      void displayEndScreen(List<Player> players)
      Displays the end screen with the players' scores and waits for the user to quit
      Parameters:
      players - The list of players whose scores are displayed

    • makeUserAnswer

      boolean makeUserAnswer(String question)
      Displays a question to the user and waits for a Yes (Y) or No (N) response.
      Parameters:
      question - The question to display to the user.
      Returns:
      True if the user responds with "Y", False if the user responds with "N".
